column4: next question:  i'm trying to download an installer iso from www.ubuntu.com, but it is offering me the iso for my desktop's architecture which is not i386.  how do I manually select the architecture to download from the site?
...i.e. -o means "or" and doesn't do the actions that match what is before it....sort of...not a great explanation
you need a path for that find comand
on karmic there is no menu.lst file, at least there wasn't on mine
That setting is in the Login Window gui
I can't change the settings once I'm logged in?
yes, it's in System > Administration > Login Window in the Accessibility tab
I have only System -> Admin -> Login Screen which only has settings for enabling automatic login - no tabs of any kind, just two radio buttons
can't remember the names, I'm on 9.10
That's Karmic. It seems they've changed that since Jaunty. Sorry about that.
...and I couldn't see anything in sound preferences either
Maybe that change has something to do with the way Karmic handles things, many things are different than in Jaunty
